newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ wool prices improve again at Napier sale.
newsitem.headline: NZ wool prices improve again at Napier sale.

text.p: Wool prices continued to improve at Thursday's Napier sale, the market indicator gaining 10 cents to 448 NZ cents per kg clean.
The strong segment indicator firmed nine cents to 281 and the lamb segment by one to 404 cents, Wools of New Zealand said.

Of the 1,431 clean tonnes on offer, nine percent was passed in. The offer comprised 67 percent second shear, 14 percent crossbred fleece, nine percent second shear bellies and pieces and five percent lambswool.
Crossbred fleece prices (35-36 micron) rose by 4-5 percent, while 37 micron rose by 2.5 percent.
Second shear, super and super good styles, rose by 3-5 percent, while good and good/average styles firmed by 2.5 percent.
First lambs wool 29/30 micron was on a par to slightly firmer and 31/32 micron (75/100 mm and longer) gained by 5.0 percent.
Second shear and bellies rose by 2.0 percent. Main interest came from Western Europe, China and local mills with support from Turkey, Nepal and Australia.
